active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, select one attack vector (SIM swap, SS7 vulnerability, malware, phishing) and one mitigation (e.g., authenticator apps, number verification). Explain the mechanism and teach-back to the group, addressing common misconceptions like 'SMS is secure because it's tied to your phone number.'
active_learning.problem_solving: Lab exercise: In a virtual environment (e.g., using SS7 simulators or phishing kits like Gophish), simulate a SIM swap or OTP phishing attack on a test web app. Propose and implement defenses (e.g., switch to TOTP), then document findings in an ethical hacking report.

Include partial truths that require deeper understanding
